title.narrative: PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION AND REPORTING

description.narrative: Government, communities and civil society capacity to work on prevention, identification and reporting of child abuse, violence and exploitation and provision of appropriate care strengthened, especially for vulnerable groups., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Justice For Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable groups, in particular children and women, benefit from adequate protection against violence, abuse and exploitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government, communities and civil society capacity to work on prevention, identification and reporting of child abuse, violenceand exploitation and provision of appropriate care strengthened, especially for vulnerable groups.

description.narrative: Continuing with UNICEF support to strengthen the technical capacity of government and civil society in the prevention and care of vulnerable families, social workers skills were improved through training on child protection and parental educational.The overall objective of these trainings is to contribute to the progressive specialization of DPSSF social workers to strengthen their capacities to prevent and response to Violence, Sexual Abuse, Mistreatment, Neglect and Abandonment.The internship program to support the Department of Social Protection has successfully continued, as well as child protection interventions in the Community Lead Total Sanitation (CLTS) communities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/01/2022
